samples.input: Who created the R programming language?

messages.content: Who created the R programming language?

content.text: R was created by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand in the early 1990s. It was developed as an implementation of the S programming language with some influences from Scheme. The name "R" comes partly from the first letter of the creators' first names and also as a play on the name of the S language.

R was created by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand in the early 1990s. It was developed as an implementation of the S programming language with some influences from Scheme. The name "R" comes partly from the first letter of the creators' first names and also as a play on the name of the S language.

samples.input: In what year was version 1.0 of R released?

messages.content: In what year was version 1.0 of R released?

content.text: R version 1.0.0 was released on February 29, 2000. This marked the first stable release of R, though the project had been in development since the early 1990s when Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman created it at the University of Auckland, New Zealand.

R version 1.0.0 was released on February 29, 2000. This marked the first stable release of R, though the project had been in development since the early 1990s when Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman created it at the University of Auckland, New Zealand.

Analyzing the factual content:

- The submitted answer contains this same information, specifying February 29, 2000 as the exact date.

The submitted answer includes additional information about R's development history, but this supplementary information doesn't contradict the expert answer. The core fact that R version 1.0 was released in 2000 is correctly stated in the submission.
